title: Fernandes
common: The surname Fernandes does not have a unique origin, because it is a patronymic meaning 'Fernando's son'. This complexity conducts Américo de Moura to list 28 different Fernandes' families with, few of them being of the same family (de Moura, Américo, 1951, pp. 355-366).

families.name: Fernandes
history: Manoel Fernandes Ramos e Suzana Dias' family.

people.name: Manuel Fernandes Ramos
history: Maria Celestina T. Mendes Torres work about Manuel Fernandes Ramos' life (Mendes Torres, Maria Celestina T., 1969, pp. 112-188) has enough information to understand better who were this person, and we suggest studying it, so we will only bring documentation to explain a confusion about his life. Manuel Fernandes Ramos was an active person in São Paulo Town Hall, he signed to build the new church (Atas de São Paulo, Volume I, pp. 344, 345) and he was also an ecclesiastical ombudsman (Atas de São Paulo, Volume I, pp. 317).

His son, André Fernandes, took actions against Camargo, and this brought "defamation" by Francisco Camargo, "o tigre", for all family (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 94-95), but there were two events that help us to show that the defamation was false:
  • A poem made in Brazil was used to argue that Fernandes were Jewish people, but words from religious, that also came from Moura, and he knew the Fernandes' family, clarified everything and avoided that Manuel's son was killed (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 48,94-95).
  • Near to his death day, Francisco de Camargo was to people's houses that he made defamation asking for forgiveness (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 5, 48,).

Américo de Moura (de Moura, Américo, 1951, pp. 360) and Luiz G. Silva Leme (Silva Leme, Luiz G., 1904, Volume VII, pp. 224) cite correctly his origin Moura, but I have to disagree with the way Luiz G. Silva Leme cites them, because his title for the Fernandes family is not specific, and this gives the idea that he is talking about all Fernandes.

When José G. Salvador worked with the family, he shows different perspectives:
  • The hypothesis that Manuel Fernandes Ramos would be a Jewish person does not have any primary source to sustain it, but it looks like there is a link with a partial primary source (Torre do Tombo, Mesa da Consciência e Ordens, Habilitações para a Ordem de Cristo, Letra G, mç. 6, n.º 66; Bogaciovas, Marcelo M. A, 2015, pp. 279-280) that is cited without to explicit the issue to be partial, it is also appended an additional novel that there were a lawfare in another religious habilitation "falcatruas que se processou na habilitação do homônimo" (Salvador, José G., 1976, pp. 31, 32). The conclusion that this partial primary source cannot be used to prove any Jewish ancestor is exposed in a diligence for Inquisition familiar of Pedro Dias Paes, son of Garcia Roiz Paes, in this document a witness that had access to Garcia Roiz Paes complete document gives details about defamation during the war between the Pires and Camargo (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 28, 47, 48, 66-69). This understanding is confirmed when we see another work from José G. Salvador where he explicitly says "Isto se torna evidente, agora, lembrando-nos de sua afinidade genealógica com Garcia Rodrigues Pais." (Salvador, José G., 1969, pp. 45).
  • In another work, firstly, he says that Manuel Fernandes Ramos is a "cristão-novo" without presenting any proof (Salvador, José G., 1976, pp. 6).
  • In the same book he shows doubt about previous information "Suzana casou com Manuel Fernandes Ramos, que supomos cristão-novo, ..." (Salvador, José G., 1976, pp. 131).
  • And once again he returns for the Jewish version "bastaria a família Fernandes para comprovar a enorme inflação da seiva Judaica" (Salvador, José G., 1976, pp. 136). I have to agree that if one unique descendant marriage a Jewish person, so that specific lineage has Jewish ancestors, but a sentence too generic like this, cannot be considered correct.

When Marcelo M. A. Bogaciovas described his' master degree dissertation, he published "... cuja dissertação continha muitos erros (inclusive de português...).2 Houve tempo hábil de apresentar uma segunda versão para a banca, mas foi a primeira versão que foi disponibilizada na internet. Continuo preparando versão final para publicação em livro..." (Bogaciovas, Marcelo M. A., 2016, pp. 756), and I agree that various mistakes were fixed, but with all possible respect to the brilliant genealogist, the book still has mistakes. There is also more research published in the book, for example, he cites the de genere of Antonio Fernandes Soares that also informs about defamation against Fernandes' family (História da Família, 2014) to show a José G. Salvador's mistake (Bogaciovas, Marcelo M. A, 2015, pp. 268-269) to consider Fernandes' family Jewish people.

people.name: André Fernandes
history:
Probably the Camargo's main enemy, considering the number of families that had defamation due to his actions (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 3-8). The hate that conducted to defamation happened because Fernandes' descendants fought together Pires during the war (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 47), but we also need to add that a Fernandes stole an indigenous "tomado uns índios de Francisco Camargo" (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 48), Francisco became sad and invaded a farm saying that "ia por fogo no judeu André Fernandes" (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 48, 94), but he did not have success due to a religious internvention that cried and told "André Fernandes não é judeu" (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 48). The basis to say that Fernandes were Jewish people was made by a poem writen by "hum Mullato chamado Luiz Fernandes" (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 67) in wartimes, the poem says
  • "entrô con grande aparato
  • aun mas de lo que convino
  • Hum Capitan Palestiino
  • Nieto de Poncio Pilato"
(Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 48, 94), the poem and defamation allow authors to use an anachronism of 14 centuries.

The available documentation in the diligence also give a list of descendant that was part of Third Order and Brotherhood of Mercy that had investigation trough various generations (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 49).
A research not finalized is showing that his mitocondrial haplogroup is C1b (subgroup) (de Sillos, Luiz Gustavo, 2023, t. 01:07:10).

people.name: Custódia Dias
history: Custódia Dias and her descendants also received defamation due to her brothers' actions (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 67).

Custódia marriage with Gerhard Bettink, that appeared in the de genere of Priest Ignácio Dias Velho appears according to a witness as "Flamengo ou Inglês" (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 51)).
Her generation appears in his husband's family.
A research not finalized is showing that her mitocondrial haplogroup is C1b (subgroup) (de Sillos, Luiz Gustavo, 2023, t. 01:07:10).

people.name: Balthazar Fernandes
history:
When cited descendants of Fernandes that are religious or took part in Third Orders religious organizations where there is investigation of many generations, the Reverend Priest José de Mascarenhas reinforce the relationship of them with him:
  • "a descendência dos Fernandes entraram muitos nas ordens Terceiras, e na irmandade da Misericórdia onde se apuram p vas gerações a limpeza destes odernarao se de sacerdotes depois da infâmia, o padre António Soares, filho de António Francisco de Abreo, bisneto por parte paterna de Baltazar Fernandes, irmão do Capitão André Fernandes, o P Frei Franco Bicudo, religioso de Nosssa Senhora do Carmo Conven.. de São Paulo, filho de Bar de Godoi Bicudo, bisneto por parte materna de Baltazar Fernandes, irmão do Cap. André Fernandes, o padre Bªr de Godoy Bicudo, filho do capitão Bernardo de Campos Bicudo terceiro neto por parte materna do .. Bar Fernades. O Pe Victorino de Borba Leite, filho do tenente general Mel de Borba Gato de huma irmã do Capm Guarda mor Garcia Roiz Paes"
(Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 49).
A research not finalized is showing that her mitocondrial haplogroup is C1b (subgroup) (de Sillos, Luiz Gustavo, 2023, t. 01:07:10).
